trans-unit.source: List the metric definitions for a resource
trans-unit.target: List the metric definitions for a resource

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="02ba2c20-1b35-4f66-b381-252156e17bb0#bk_common" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to events.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="02ba2c20-1b35-4f66-b381-252156e17bb0#bk_common" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to events.

trans-unit.source: Replace {resource-provider-namespace}, {resource-type}, and {resource-name} with the segments from the Resource ID you are interested in getting metrics for.
trans-unit.target: Replace {resource-provider-namespace}, {resource-type}, and {resource-name} with the segments from the Resource ID you are interested in getting metrics for.

trans-unit.source: For example, to get the metrics from a SQL database name “myDB” on “myServer” the request looks like:
trans-unit.target: For example, to get the metrics from a SQL database name “myDB” on “myServer” the request looks like:

trans-unit.source: The $filter parameter is optional, and can be used to only retrieve certain metric definitions.
trans-unit.target: The $filter parameter is optional, and can be used to only retrieve certain metric definitions.

trans-unit.source: For example, get just the definition for the CPU percentage counter, you can perform the following request:
trans-unit.target: For example, get just the definition for the CPU percentage counter, you can perform the following request:

trans-unit.source:
$filter=name.value eq '\Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time'

This $filter is very restricted and allows only these "name eq " clauses separated by " or "s.
trans-unit.target:
$filter=name.value eq '\Processor(_Total)\% Processor Time'

This $filter is very restricted and allows only these "name eq " clauses separated by " or "s.

trans-unit.source: LocalizableString object containing the name and a localized value.
trans-unit.target: LocalizableString object containing the name and a localized value.

trans-unit.source: Representing the units of the metric.
trans-unit.target: Representing the units of the metric.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are: Count, Bytes, Seconds, Percent, CountPerSecond, BytesPerSecond.
trans-unit.target: Possible values are: Count, Bytes, Seconds, Percent, CountPerSecond, BytesPerSecond.

trans-unit.source: Enumeration value defining how to use the values for display.
trans-unit.target: Enumeration value defining how to use the values for display.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are: None, Average, Total, Minimum, Maximum, Last.
trans-unit.target: Possible values are: None, Average, Total, Minimum, Maximum, Last.

trans-unit.source: Collection of availability information defining what timeGrains are available to be queried and its retention.
trans-unit.target: Collection of availability information defining what timeGrains are available to be queried and its retention.

trans-unit.source: Metrics will be available for this timegrain.
trans-unit.target: Metrics will be available for this timegrain.

trans-unit.source: Metrics may be queried for this interval.
trans-unit.target: Metrics may be queried for this interval.

trans-unit.source: Expressed as a duration as above.
trans-unit.target: Expressed as a duration as above.

trans-unit.source: For example, 'P30D' means the metric is retained and hence could be queried for up to 30 days in the past.
trans-unit.target: For example, 'P30D' means the metric is retained and hence could be queried for up to 30 days in the past.

trans-unit.source: Details of the location of the metric data that's stored.
trans-unit.target: Details of the location of the metric data that's stored.
